title: Eps. 86 - Instagram Vegan
description:
The journey of entrepreneurship is not easy and as a small company things are even harder. In this episode the guys discuss the growing pains of ETA with a staff meeting amongst themselves. CJ and Karl give some great tips that entrepreneurs and small business owners need to be conscious of as well as some things that will help you stand out. Keep in mind that as a small business mistakes are going to be made and things are going to fall through the cracks. Just make the adjustments and never stop growing.
 Time Stamped Topics:
  [05:50] - Squad Phobias
 [33:00] - No longer the underdog
 [54:00] - Understand Your Customer
 [1:00:00] - Figure Out Your Advantages
 [1:20:00] - Ask ET
 [1:29:00] - Nugget of The Day
  Things To Think About:
  “If you get in the water with business you have to learn how to swim.”
 “Just because you’re small you don’t have to act small.”
 “Most people start and they never finish what they start.”
  Listener Perks:
  PayPal is offering our listeners $5,000 business loan with NO credit check. Additional terms and conditions apply please visit www.PayPal.com/success.
 Organifi is giving our listeners 20% off of their order just use the promo code “SUCCESS”. Their superfood green juice powder allows you to get your greens anytime anywhere while on the go
  See ET Live:
  Washington, D.C. September 2 Stay Ready Conference

 Los Angeles, CA  November 12 Stay Ready Conference
 March 2018  Phenomenal Life Cruise

  Get connected with a network of over 3,500 people who listen to ET, and embodies the work ethic and spirit of ET. To learn more about Breathe University. Subscribe to the podcast via  Apple Podcasts

The journey of entrepreneurship is not easy and as a small company things are even harder. In this episode the guys discuss the growing pains of ETA with a staff meeting amongst themselves. CJ and Karl give some great tips that entrepreneurs and small business owners need to be conscious of as well as some things that will help you stand out. Keep in mind that as a small business mistakes are going to be made and things are going to fall through the cracks. Just make the adjustments and never stop growing.
